questions.question: Is the autobiographical element important inRaymond Carver's stories?

choices.answer: No, he actually tries to avoid autobiographical elements
Only in very few of his stories
Yes,  the stories must connect with the real world.

questions.question: Raymond Carver's wife gave him an idea for one of his short stories. What is the title of that story?

choices.answer: "Fat"
"Heaven must be missing an angel"
"Old Man Blues"

questions.question: What kind of dialogue does Raymond Carver like to write?

choices.answer: Dialogues with long sentences
Dialogue between people who aren't listening to each other
Dialogues with people who communicate well

questions.question: Right-wing critics in the U.S.A. have attacked Raymond Carver for...

choices.answer: ...for writing sweet and innocent stories
...for writing stories about the people who don't succeed
...for writing long and boring stories

questions.question: Does Raymond Carver revise his stories?

choices.answer: No, he usually gets it right the first time
Sometimes he revises his stories a couple of times
He revises his storie 15 or maybe 20 times

questions.question: What does Raymond Carver think about Ernest Hemingway?

choices.answer: Hemingway's sentences are like poetry
He prefers Faulkner to hemingway
Hemingway is very old fashioned

questions.question: Readers sometimes get a little frustrated by the endings of his stories. How does Raymond Carver respond to this?

choices.answer: He wants people to be frustrated
he doesn't really care about that
He wants there to be some mystery in the stories
